</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Represents
	the UPB of impaired loans less unearned revenue and other holdbacks and adjustments by asset class and was comprised of nine loans at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and ten loans at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Represents
	an average of the beginning and ending UPB of each asset class.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, three loans with an aggregate net carrying value of less than $0.1&nbsp;million, net of related loan loss reserves on the loans of $22.9&nbsp;million,
	were classified as non-performing. Income from non-performing loans is generally recognized on a cash basis only to the extent it is received. Full income recognition will resume when the loan becomes
	contractually current and performance has recommenced. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, three loans with an aggregate net carrying value of
	$7.0&nbsp;million, net of related loan loss reserves on two of the loans of $34.0&nbsp;million, were classified as non-performing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	83
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, we did not have any loans contractually past due 90&nbsp;days or more that are still accruing interest.
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	were no loans in which we considered the modifications to be troubled debt restructurings that were subsequently considered non-performing as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014
	and no additional loans were considered to be impaired due to our troubled debt restructuring analysis for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. We had unfunded commitments of
	$0.1&nbsp;million on the extended loans which were considered troubled debt restructurings as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and no unfunded commitment on the extended loan which was considered
	troubled debt restructuring as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Given
	the transitional nature of some of our real estate loans, we may require funds to be placed into an interest reserve, based on contractual requirements, to cover debt service
	costs. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had total interest reserves of $17.2&nbsp;million on 63 loans with an aggregate UPB of $895.4&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	84
</FONT>
</P>

<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	Cumulative
<BR>
	Unrealized
<BR>
	(Loss) / Gain

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the fourth quarter of 2015, we purchased a federal home loan mortgage corporation security at a premium for $1.6&nbsp;million. This security bore interest at a fixed rate of 3.241%
	with a scheduled maturity in 2024. We sold this security in January 2016 for $1.6&nbsp;million and recognized a gain of less than $0.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the second quarter of 2015, our CMBS investment, which had a carrying value of $2.0&nbsp;million, paid off in full. In connection with this pay off, we received proceeds of
	$2.1&nbsp;million and reversed a $0.1&nbsp;million unrealized loss from accumulated other comprehensive loss on our consolidated balance sheet. Our CMBS investment had an underlying credit rating
	of CCC&#150; based on the rating published by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the first quarter of 2014, we sold all of our RMBS investments, which had an aggregate carrying value of $33.4&nbsp;million, for $33.9&nbsp;million and recorded a net gain of
	$0.5&nbsp;million to other income, net on our consolidated statements of income, which includes the reclassification of a net unrealized gain of $0.4&nbsp;million from accumulated other
	comprehensive loss on our consolidated balance sheet. Included in these sales were two RMBS investments with deteriorated credit quality that had an aggregate carrying
	value of $25.8&nbsp;million and that were sold for $25.9&nbsp;million. The RMBS investments were financed with two repurchase agreements totaling $25.3&nbsp;million which were repaid with the
	proceeds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	weighted average yield on our CMBS and RMBS investments, including the amortization of premium and the accretion of discount, based on their face values was 1.04% and 1.80% for the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	85
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	account for all investments in equity affiliates under the equity method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Arbor Residential Investor&nbsp;LLC ("ARI")
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In the first quarter of 2015, we invested $9.6&nbsp;million for 50% of
	our Manager's indirect interest in a joint venture with a third party that was formed to invest in a residential mortgage banking business. Our Manager retained a promote of 25% over a 10% return on
	this investment. As a result of this transaction, we had an initial indirect interest of 22.5% in the mortgage banking business, which is subject to dilution upon attaining certain profit hurdles of
	the business. As a result of the business's profitability to date, we currently own a 20% indirect interest. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recorded $6.6&nbsp;million to income
	from equity affiliates in our consolidated statements of income related to this investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the first quarter of 2015, we invested $1.7&nbsp;million through ARI for 100% of our Manager's investment in non-qualified residential mortgages purchased from the mortgage banking
	business's origination platform, resulting in a non-controlling ownership interest of 50% in this investment. We also funded $7.9&nbsp;million of additional mortgage purchases during 2015, for a
	total investment of $9.7&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. During 2015, we recorded income from equity affiliates of less than $0.1&nbsp;million in our consolidated statements of income
	related to this investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	West Shore Caf&eacute;
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We own a 50% noncontrolling interest in the West Shore Lake Caf&eacute;, a
	restaurant/inn lakefront property in Lake Tahoe, California. During the second quarter of 2014, we provided a $1.7&nbsp;million first mortgage loan to an affiliated entity to acquire property
	adjacent to the original property, which matures in May 2017 and bears interest at LIBOR plus 4.00%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Lightstone Value Plus REIT&nbsp;L.P. / JT Prime
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We own a $1.9&nbsp;million interest in an unconsolidated joint
	venture that holds common operating partnership units of Lightstone Value Plus REIT&nbsp;L.P. ("Lightstone"). The joint venture owned $56.0&nbsp;million of preferred and common operating
	partnership units of Lightstone and had debt of $50.2&nbsp;million, in which we had a two thirds interest in a consolidated entity. In 2013, our portion of the preferred operating partnership units
	were redeemed, the note related to our portion was repaid in full and the entity was deconsolidated. During the year
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	86
</FONT>
</P>

	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;5&#151;Investments in Equity Affiliates (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recorded $1.8&nbsp;million of dividends from the operating partnership units which were reflected in interest income, and $1.3&nbsp;million of interest expense
	in our consolidated
	statements of income. We also own a 50% non-controlling interest in an unconsolidated joint venture, JT Prime, which holds common operating partnership units of Lightstone at a carrying value of
	$0.4&nbsp;million. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we recorded $0.2&nbsp;million, $0.2&nbsp;million and $0.1&nbsp;million, respectively, to income from equity
	affiliates in our consolidated statements of income related to these investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Issuers of Junior Subordinated Notes
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We have invested a total of $0.6&nbsp;million for 100% of the common shares of two
	affiliated entities of ours. These entities pay dividends on both the common shares and preferred securities on a quarterly basis at variable rates based on three-month LIBOR. See
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;"Debt Obligations" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	East River Portfolio
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;In August 2014, we invested $0.1&nbsp;million for a 5% interest in a joint venture that owns two
	multifamily properties. The joint venture is comprised of a consortium of investors consisting of certain of our officers, including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, and other related parties, who together
	own an interest of 95%. In August 2014, we originated two bridge loans totaling $5.0&nbsp;million with an interest rate of 5.5% over one-month LIBOR and a maturity date of March 2016. See
	Note&nbsp;14&#151;"Agreements and Transactions with Related Parties" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Lexford Portfolio
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We, along with third party investors, made a $0.1&nbsp;million equity investment into Lexford, a
	portfolio of multifamily assets. Our portion of this investment is a $44,000 noncontrolling interest. In the third and fourth quarters of 2015, we received distributions from this equity investment
	and recognized income totaling $4.5&nbsp;million, net of expenses. The $4.5&nbsp;million of income is comprised of income from equity affiliates of $5.5&nbsp;million, partially offset by
	$1.0&nbsp;million of expenses related to these distributions that were recorded in employee compensation and benefits. See Note&nbsp;14&#151;"Agreements and Transactions with Related
	Parties" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Ritz-Carlton Club
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We owned a 19.09% non-controlling interest with a 10% return subject to certain conditions in the
	Ritz-Carlton Club, a condominium project in Lake Tahoe, California. During 2012, we recorded $0.8&nbsp;million of losses from the entity against the equity investment reducing the balance of our
	investment to $0. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we no longer have an interest in this investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	930 Flushing&nbsp;&amp; 80 Evergreen
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We had a 12.5% preferred interest in a joint venture that owns and operates two
	commercial properties. We also had a $22.4&nbsp;million bridge loan and a
	$0.5&nbsp;million mezzanine loan outstanding to affiliated entities of the joint venture. In May 2014, our interest in the properties was sold and we received $7.9&nbsp;million in cash. As a
	result, we recorded a gain on sale of equity interest in our consolidated statements of income of $7.9&nbsp;million and reduced our investment to $0. In July 2014, our outstanding loans totaling
	$22.9&nbsp;million to this joint venture were repaid in full. We no longer have an interest in this investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	87
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;5&#151;Investments in Equity Affiliates (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	450 West 33rd&nbsp;Street
</U>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;We were a 29% participant in an investor group that owned a non-controlling interest in an
	office building at 450 West 33rd&nbsp;Street in Manhattan, New York. The investor group, as a whole, had a 1.44% ownership interest in the property and 50% of the property's air rights, both were
	retained from the transfer of control of the property in 2007. As part of this transaction, we recorded a deferred gain of $77.1&nbsp;million as a result of the joint venture members guaranteeing a
	portion of the debt outstanding on the property. In 2014, the existing debt on the property was refinanced and our portion of the guarantee was terminated, resulting in the recognition of the
	$77.1&nbsp;million deferred gain as well as a $19.0&nbsp;million prepaid incentive management fee for a non-cash net gain of $58.1&nbsp;million. See Note&nbsp;14&#151;"Agreements and
	Transactions with Related Parties" for details of the prepaid incentive fee recorded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2014, we invested an additional $0.3&nbsp;million into this investment. In the fourth quarter of 2014, we sold our remaining interest in this property for $1.1&nbsp;million and
	recorded a gain on sale of $0.8&nbsp;million. We no longer have an interest in this investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_41"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

	Summarized Financial Information
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	as follows:

<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">

	&#8203;

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Combined
	with $0.6&nbsp;million of equity relating to the issuance of junior subordinated notes, equals $30.9&nbsp;million of investments in equity
	affiliates at December&nbsp;31, 2015. Combined with $0.6&nbsp;million of equity relating to the issuance of junior subordinated notes, equals $4.9&nbsp;million of investments in equity
	affiliates at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;6&#151;Real Estate Owned and Held-For-Sale
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our real estate assets were comprised of three multifamily properties (the "Multifamily Portfolio"), two hotel properties (the "Hotel Portfolio") and an office building at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and four multifamily properties and five hotel properties at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Multifamily Portfolio had a mortgage note payable of $27.2&nbsp;million and $31.0&nbsp;million, respectively. See
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;"Debt Obligations" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, our Multifamily Portfolio had a weighted average occupancy rate of approximately 94%, 90% and 85%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	89
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=92,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=120067,FOLIO='89',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FU76901A.;18',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;12:36' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU76901_1_90">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;6&#151;Real Estate Owned and Held-For-Sale (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, our Hotel Portfolio had a weighted average occupancy rate of approximately 53%, 51% and 48%, respectively, a weighted average
	daily rate of approximately $90, $76 and $79, respectively, and a weighted average revenue per available room of approximately $48, $39 and $38, respectively. The operation of the hotel properties are
	seasonal with the majority of revenues earned in the first two quarters of the calendar year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the third quarter of 2015, we acquired an office building by deed in lieu of foreclosure that was held as collateral for a first mortgage loan with a carrying value at the acquisition
	date of $5.9&nbsp;million, net of reserves. We finalized the purchase price allocation in the fourth quarter of 2015. The office building was fully occupied at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	real estate assets had restricted cash balances totaling $1.6&nbsp;million and $1.7&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, due to escrow
	requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Real Estate Held-For-Sale
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was one property in the Hotel Portfolio with a carrying value of $8.7&nbsp;million classified
	as real estate held-for-sale. In 2015, three properties in the Hotel Portfolio with a combined carrying value of $26.2&nbsp;million were reclassified from real estate owned to real estate
	held-for-sale due to proposed sales. Two of these properties were sold in 2015 and we recognized a total gain of $3.8&nbsp;million. Also in 2015, we sold a property in our Multifamily Portfolio as
	well as a property in the Hotel Portfolio classified as held-for-sale for a total of $18.8&nbsp;million and recognized a gain of $4.0&nbsp;million. In 2014, a property in the Multifamily Portfolio
	was sold for $3.1&nbsp;million. In connection with this sale, we recorded a loss on sale of $0.2&nbsp;million and a reduction of the mortgage note payable of $3.4&nbsp;million. During 2014, we
	recorded an impairment loss of $0.3&nbsp;million related to this property as a result of an impairment analysis based on indicators of value from market participants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	results of operations for properties classified as held-for-sale are summarized as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>

</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We utilize various forms of short-term and long-term financing agreements to finance certain of our loans and investments. Borrowings underlying these arrangements are primarily secured
	by a significant amount of our loans and investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	90
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the weighted average interest rate for our credit facilities and repurchase agreements was 2.69% and 2.84%, respectively, and was calculated on the
	outstanding principal balance of the facility. Including certain fees and costs, such as structuring, commitment, non-use and warehousing fees, the weighted average interest rate was 3.42% and 3.06%
	at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. There were no interest rate swaps on these facilities at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2015, we entered into a $150.0&nbsp;million warehouse repurchase facility with a financial institution to finance a significant portion of the unwind of our CDO I and CDO II
	vehicles. See "Collateralized Debt Obligations" below. The facility bears interest at a rate of 212.5 basis points over LIBOR on senior mortgage loans, 350.0 basis points over LIBOR on junior mortgage
	loans, and matures in January 2017 with a one-year extension option. If the estimated market value of the loans financed in this facility decrease, we may be required to pay down borrowings under this
	repurchase agreement. Debt carrying value is net of $0.7&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2015. In July 2015, we amended the facility to temporarily increase the
	committed amount to $175.0&nbsp;million until December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have a $100.0&nbsp;million warehouse facility with a financial institution to finance first mortgage loans on multifamily properties that bore interest at a rate of 225 basis points
	over LIBOR and was to mature in April 2015. In April 2015, we extended the maturity to May 2015. In May 2015, we amended the facility decreasing the rate of interest to 215 basis points over LIBOR and
	extended the maturity to May 2017 with a one-year extension option, subject to certain conditions. The facility has a maximum advance rate of 75% and also has a compensating balance requirement of
	$50.0&nbsp;million to be maintained by us and our affiliates. Debt carrying value is net of $0.3&nbsp;million and $0.2&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and
	2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have a $75.0&nbsp;million warehouse facility with a financial institution to finance first mortgage loans on multifamily properties that bore interest at a rate of 225 basis points
	over LIBOR and was to
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	91
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	mature
	in June 2015. In June 2015, we amended the facility, extending the maturity to June 2016, decreasing the rate of interest to 212.5 basis points over LIBOR, and added a new $25.0&nbsp;million
	sublimit to finance healthcare related loans. The healthcare related loans will have an interest rate ranging from 225 basis points to 250 basis points over LIBOR depending on the type of healthcare
	facility financed. The facility has a maximum advance rate of 75%. Debt carrying value is net of $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at both December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have another $75.0&nbsp;million warehouse facility with a financial institution to finance first mortgage loans on multifamily and commercial properties that bears interest at a
	rate of 200 basis points over LIBOR and was to mature in April 2015. In April 2015, the facility was increased from $60.0&nbsp;million to $75.0&nbsp;million and the maturity was extended to April
	2016. The facility has a maximum advance rate of 70% or 75%, depending on the property type. Debt carrying value is net of less than $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at both
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2015, we entered into a $25.0&nbsp;million warehouse facility with a financial institution to finance first mortgage loans on multifamily properties. The facility bears
	interest at a rate of 200 basis points over LIBOR and was to mature in February 2016. Debt carrying value is net of less than $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31,
	2015. In February 2016, we amended the facility, increasing the committed amount to $50.0&nbsp;million and extending the maturity to February 2017 with two one-year extension options, subject to
	certain conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	September 2015, we entered into a $16.5&nbsp;million term facility with a financial institution to finance a first mortgage loan. The facility bears interest at a rate of 275 basis
	points over LIBOR, matures in December 2016 and has a compensating balance requirement of $3.0&nbsp;million to be maintained by us and our affiliates. Debt carrying value is net of
	$0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	had a $15.0&nbsp;million term facility that bore interest at a fixed rate of 7.5%, had a maturity in August 2015 and was secured by a portion of the bonds originally issued by our
	CDO III entity that we repurchased. We repaid this facility in full in July 2015. Debt carrying value is net of less than $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2015, we entered into an $87.0&nbsp;million warehouse repurchase facility with a financial institution to finance the acquisition of a first mortgage note. The facility bore
	interest at a rate of 250&nbsp;basis points over a LIBOR floor of 0.25% and was to mature in March 2016. The facility was fully repaid in April 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	warehouse credit facilities generally allow for an original warehousing period of up to 24&nbsp;months from the initial advance on an asset. In addition, our credit facilities and
	repurchase agreements contain several restrictions including full repayment of an advance if a loan becomes 60&nbsp;days past due, is in default or is written down by us. Our credit facilities and
	repurchase agreements also contain representations, warranties, covenants, conditions precedent to funding, events of default and indemnities that are customary for agreements of these types. See
	"Debt Covenants" below for details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	92
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CLO
	II&#151;Issued two investment grade tranches in January 2013 with a stated maturity date in February 2023. Interest was variable based on three-month LIBOR; the weighted
	average note rate was 2.56%. Debt carrying value is net of $1.6&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CLO
	III&#151;Issued three investment grade tranches in April 2014 with a replacement period through October 2016 and a stated maturity date in May 2024. Interest is variable based
	on three-month LIBOR; the weighted average note rate was 2.86% and 2.60% at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Debt carrying value is net of $2.1&nbsp;million and $3.5&nbsp;million
	of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CLO
	IV&#151;Issued three investment grade tranches in February 2015 with a replacement period through September 2017 and a stated maturity date in March 2025. Interest is variable
	based on three-month LIBOR; the weighted average note rate was 2.71% at December&nbsp;31, 2015. Debt carrying value is net of $3.0&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31,
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CLO
	V&#151;Issued three investment grade tranches in August 2015 with a replacement period through September 2018 and a stated maturity date in September 2025. Interest is
	variable based on one-month LIBOR; the weighted average note rate was 2.91% at December&nbsp;31, 2015. Debt carrying value is net of $3.8&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	93
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=96,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=548933,FOLIO='93',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FU76901A.;18',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;12:36' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU76901_1_94">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Represents
	restricted cash held for principal repayments as well as for reinvestment in the CLOs. Does not include restricted cash related to interest
	payments, delayed fundings and expenses.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Amounts
	represent the face value of collateral in default, as defined by the CLO indenture, as well as assets deemed to be "credit risk." Credit risk assets
	are reported by each of the CLOs and are generally defined as one that, in the CLO collateral manager's reasonable business judgment, has a significant risk of declining in credit quality or, with a
	passage of time, becoming a defaulted asset.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August 2015, we completed a collateralized securitization vehicle ("CLO V"), issuing to third party investors three tranches of investment grade CLOs through two newly-formed
	wholly-owned subsidiaries totaling $267.8&nbsp;million, of which we purchased $12.5&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;C notes that we subsequently sold at par for $12.5&nbsp;million. As of the CLO
	closing date, the notes are secured by a portfolio of loan obligations with a face value of approximately $302.6&nbsp;million, consisting primarily of bridge loans that were contributed from our
	existing loan portfolio. The financing has an approximate three year replacement period that allows the principal proceeds and sale proceeds (if any) of the loan obligations to be reinvested in
	qualifying replacement loan obligations, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the indenture. Thereafter, the outstanding debt balance will be reduced as loans are repaid.
	Initially, the proceeds of the issuance of the securities also included $47.4&nbsp;million
	for the purpose of acquiring additional loan obligations for a period of up to 120&nbsp;days from the closing date of the CLO. In September 2015, the additional proceeds were fully utilized
	resulting in the issuer owning loan obligations with a face value of approximately $350.0&nbsp;million. The aggregate principal amounts of the three classes of notes are $197.8&nbsp;million of
	Class&nbsp;A senior secured floating rate notes, $24.5&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;B secured floating rate notes and $45.5&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;C secured floating rate notes. We
	retained a residual interest in the portfolio with a notional amount of approximately $82.3&nbsp;million. The notes have an initial weighted average interest rate of approximately 2.44% plus
	one-month LIBOR and interest payments on the notes are payable monthly. Including certain fees and costs, the initial weighted average note rate was 3.07%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2015, we completed the unwinding of CLO II, redeeming $177.0&nbsp;million of our outstanding notes which were repaid primarily from the refinancing of the remaining assets
	within our new and existing financing facilities as well as with cash held by the CLO and expensed approximately $1.5&nbsp;million of deferred fees in the first quarter of 2015 into interest expense
	on the consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2015, we completed a collateralized securitization vehicle ("CLO IV"), issuing to third party investors three tranches of investment grade CLOs through two newly-formed
	wholly-owned subsidiaries totaling $219.0&nbsp;million. At closing, the notes were secured by a portfolio of loan obligations with a face value of approximately $250.0&nbsp;million, consisting
	primarily of bridge loans that were contributed from our existing loan portfolio. The financing has an approximate 2.5&nbsp;year replacement period from closing that allows the principal proceeds
	and sale proceeds (if any) of the loan obligations to be reinvested in qualifying replacement loan obligations, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions set forth in the indenture.
	Thereafter, the outstanding debt balance will be reduced as loans are repaid. Initially, the proceeds of the issuance of the securities also included $50.0&nbsp;million for the purpose of acquiring
	additional loan obligations for a period of up to 120&nbsp;days from the closing date of the CLO. In April 2015, the $50.0&nbsp;million of additional proceeds was fully utilized. The aggregate
	principal amounts of the three classes of notes are $165.8&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;A senior secured floating
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	94
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=97,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=339739,FOLIO='94',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FU76901A.;18',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;12:36' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU76901_1_95">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	rate
	notes, $24.8&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;B secured floating rate notes and $28.5&nbsp;million of Class&nbsp;C secured floating rate notes. We retained a residual interest in the portfolio
	with a notional amount of approximately $81.0&nbsp;million. The notes have an initial weighted average interest rate of approximately 2.24% plus one-month LIBOR and interest payments on the notes
	are payable monthly. Including certain fees and costs, the initial weighted average note rate was 2.96%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the aggregate weighted average note rate for our CLOs was 2.84% and 2.59%, respectively. Including certain fees and costs, the weighted average note
	rate was 3.24% and 3.14% at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Collateralized Debt Obligations (CDOs)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In July 2015, we completed the unwind of CDO III, redeeming $71.1&nbsp;million of our outstanding notes. The notes were repaid
	primarily from proceeds received from the refinancing of CDO III's remaining assets within our existing financing facilities, as well as with cash held by the CDO. We also terminated a related
	interest rate swap and incurred a loss of $0.3&nbsp;million in the third quarter of 2015. See Note&nbsp;8&#151;"Derivative Financial Instruments" for additional details. CDO III had a
	$100.0&nbsp;million revolving note class that provided a revolving note facility, which was paid off in the first quarter of 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2015, we completed the unwind of CDO I and CDO II, redeeming $167.9&nbsp;million of our outstanding notes. The notes were repaid primarily from proceeds received from the
	refinancing of CDO I and II's remaining assets within a new $150.0&nbsp;million warehouse repurchase facility and our existing financing facilities, as well as with cash held by each CDO. As a
	result of this transaction, we generated approximately $30.0&nbsp;million in cash equity and expensed $0.5&nbsp;million of deferred fees in the first quarter of 2015. We also terminated the
	related basis and interest rate swaps and incurred a loss of $4.3&nbsp;million in the first quarter of 2015. See Note&nbsp;8&#151;"Derivative Financial Instruments" for additional details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2010, we re-issued our own CDO bonds we had acquired throughout 2009 with an aggregate face amount of approximately $42.8&nbsp;million as part of an exchange for the retirement of
	$114.1&nbsp;million of our junior subordinated notes. This transaction resulted in the recording of $65.2&nbsp;million of additional CDO debt, of which $42.3&nbsp;million represented the portion
	of our CDO bonds that were exchanged and $22.9&nbsp;million represented the estimated interest due on the reissued bonds through their maturity. In January 2015, we unwound our CDO I and CDO II
	vehicles and reduced the balance of estimated interest by $11.0&nbsp;million and in July 2015, we unwound our CDO III vehicle and reduced the remaining balance of estimated interest by
	$8.2&nbsp;million, recording a gain on acceleration of deferred income in the consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	95
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CDO
	I&#151;Issued four investment grade tranches in January 2005 with a stated maturity date in February 2040. Interest was variable based on three-month LIBOR; the weighted
	average note rate was 3.23% at December&nbsp;31, 2014. Debt carrying value is net of $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CDO
	II&#151;Issued nine investment grade tranches in January 2006 with a stated maturity date in April 2038. Interest was variable based on three-month LIBOR; the weighted average
	note rate was 6.22% at December&nbsp;31, 2014. Debt carrying value is net of less than $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CDO
	III&#151;Issued ten investment grade tranches in December 2006 with a stated maturity date in January 2042. Interest was variable based on three-month LIBOR; the weighted
	average note rate was 0.98% at December&nbsp;31, 2014. Debt carrying value is net of less than $0.1&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Amounts
	include loans to real estate assets consolidated by us that were reclassified to real estate owned and held-for-sale, net on the consolidated
	financial statements.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Represents
	restricted cash held for principal repayments in the CDOs. Does not include restricted cash related to interest payments, delayed fundings and
	expenses.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Amounts
	represent the face value of collateral in default, as defined by the CDO indenture, as well as assets deemed to be "credit risk." Credit risk assets
	are reported by each of the CDOs and are generally defined as one that, in the CDO collateral manager's reasonable business judgment, has a significant risk of declining in credit quality or, with a
	passage of time, becoming a defaulted asset.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, the aggregate weighted average note rate for our CDOs, including the cost of interest rate swaps on assets financed in these facilities, was 3.13%. Excluding
	the effect of swaps, the weighted average note rate at December&nbsp;31, 2014 was 1.07%. Including certain fees and costs, the weighted average note rate was 3.55% at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	account for our CLO and CDO transactions on our consolidated balance sheet as financing facilities. Our CLOs and CDOs are VIEs for which we are the primary beneficiary and are
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	96
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	consolidated
	in our financial statements accordingly. The investment grade tranches are treated as secured financings, and are non-recourse to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Senior Unsecured Notes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2014, we issued $90.0&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of 7.375% senior unsecured notes due in 2021 in an underwritten
	public offering for net proceeds of $85.4&nbsp;million after deducting the issuance and underwriting discounts and offering expenses. In connection with this offering, the underwriters exercised a
	portion of their overallotment option for a $7.8&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount providing additional net proceeds of $7.4&nbsp;million. Debt carrying value is net of $4.1&nbsp;million
	and $4.8&nbsp;million of deferred financing fees at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The notes can be redeemed by us after May&nbsp;15, 2017. The interest is paid quarterly in
	February, May, August, and November starting in August 2014. Including certain fees and costs, the weighted average note rate was 8.12% and 8.06% at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. We
	used the net proceeds to make investments, to repurchase or pay liabilities and for general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Junior Subordinated Notes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The carrying value of borrowings under our junior subordinated notes was $157.1&nbsp;million and $156.4&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, which is net of a deferred amount of $15.5&nbsp;million and $16.0&nbsp;million, respectively, that is being amortized into interest expense over
	the life of the notes, and $3.3&nbsp;million and $3.4&nbsp;million, respectively, of deferred financing fees. These notes have maturities ranging from March 2034 through April 2037, pay interest
	quarterly at a fixed or floating rate of interest based on three-month LIBOR and were not redeemable for the first two years. The current weighted average note rate was 3.12% and 3.01% at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Including certain fees and costs, the weighted average note rate was 3.55% and 3.18% at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The entities
	that issued the junior subordinated notes have been deemed VIEs. See Note&nbsp;9&#151;"Variable Interest Entities" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=100,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=417189,FOLIO='97',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FU76901A.;18',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;12:36' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FW76901_1_98">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the note rate for our note payable was 0%. There were no interest rate swaps on the note payable at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	had a $1.3&nbsp;million junior loan participation on a $1.3&nbsp;million bridge loan that was written-off in the third quarter of 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	obligation to pay interest on the junior loan participations is based on the performance of the related loan. Interest expense is based on the portion of the interest received from
	the loan that is paid to the junior participant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Mortgage Note Payable&#151;Real Estate Owned and Held-For-Sale
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the first quarter of 2015, we made required paydowns of $10.3&nbsp;million and repaid the Multifamily Portfolio mortgage of
	$20.7&nbsp;million, replacing it with two new notes payable totaling $27.2&nbsp;million. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the new notes payable consist of a $24.7&nbsp;million secured loan that
	bears interest at a fixed rate of 3.00% and matures in December 2017, as well as a $2.5&nbsp;million, unsecured loan that bears interest at a variable rate of one-month LIBOR plus 2.75% and matures
	in December 2016. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the prior mortgage had an outstanding balance of $31.0&nbsp;million, bore interest at a variable rate of one-month LIBOR plus 1.23% and was to mature
	in June 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Debt Covenants
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our debt facilities contain various financial covenants and restrictions, including a minimum liquidity requirement of
	$20.0&nbsp;million, minimum net worth requirement of $100.0&nbsp;million to $300.0&nbsp;million depending on the debt facility and a maximum total liabilities less subordinated debt requirement
	of $2.0&nbsp;billion, as well as certain other debt service coverage ratios and debt to equity ratios. We were in compliance with all financial covenants and restrictions at December&nbsp;31,
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	CLO vehicles contain interest coverage and asset overcollateralization covenants that must be met as of the waterfall distribution date in order for us to receive such payments. If
	we fail these covenants in any of our CLOs, all cash flows from the applicable CLO would be diverted to repay principal and interest on the outstanding CLO bonds and we would not receive any residual
	payments until that CLO regained compliance with such tests. Our CLOs were in compliance with all such covenants as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, as well as on the most recent determination dates in
	January and February 2016. In the event of a breach of the CLO covenants that could not be cured in the near-term, we would be required to fund our non-CLO expenses, including management fees and
	employee costs, distributions required to maintain REIT status, debt costs, and other expenses with (i)&nbsp;cash on hand, (ii)&nbsp;income from any CLO not in breach of a covenant test,
	(iii)&nbsp;income from real property and loan assets, (iv)&nbsp;sale of assets, or (v)&nbsp;accessing the equity or debt capital markets, if available. We have the right to cure covenant
	breaches which would resume normal residual payments to us by purchasing non-performing loans out of the CLOs. However, we may not have sufficient liquidity available to do so at such time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	98
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Overcollateralization(1)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	overcollateralization ratio divides the total principal balance of all collateral in the CLO by the total principal balance of the bonds associated with
	the applicable ratio. To the extent an asset is considered a defaulted security, the asset's principal balance for purposes of the overcollateralization test is the lesser of the asset's market value
	or the principal balance of the defaulted asset multiplied by the asset's recovery rate which is determined by the rating agencies. Rating downgrades of CLO collateral will generally not have a direct
	impact on the principal balance of a CLO asset for purposes of calculating the CLO overcollateralization test unless the rating downgrade is below a significantly low threshold
	(e.g.&nbsp;CCC&#150;) as defined in each CLO vehicle.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	interest coverage ratio divides interest income by interest expense for the classes senior to those retained by us.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	chart below is a summary of our CLO overcollateralization ratios as of the determination dates subsequent to each quarter end:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_50"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;Debt Obligations (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	ratio will fluctuate based on the performance of the underlying assets, transfers of assets into the CLOs prior to the expiration of their respective replenishment dates, purchase or
	disposal of other investments, and loan payoffs. No payment due under the junior subordinated indentures may be paid if there is a default under any senior debt and the senior lender has sent notice
	to the trustee. The junior subordinated indentures are also cross-defaulted with each other.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_51"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">

</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	non-qualifying basis swaps hedges were used to manage our exposure to interest rate movements and other identified risks but do not meet hedge accounting requirements. We are exposed
	to changes in the fair value of certain of our fixed rate obligations due to changes in benchmark interest rates and use interest rate swaps to manage our exposure to changes in fair value on these
	instruments attributable to changes in the benchmark interest rate. These qualifying interest rate swaps designated as fair value hedges involve the receipt of variable-rate amounts from a
	counterparty in exchange for us making fixed-rate payments over the life of the agreements without the exchange of the underlying notional amount. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, CDO
	II was unwound and the related basis swap with a notional value of $3.0&nbsp;million and a fair value of less than $0.1&nbsp;million was terminated and recorded as a loss. See
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;"Debt Obligations&#151;Collateralized Debt Obligations" for further details. Also during 2015, a non-qualifying LIBOR cap hedge with a notional value of
	$71.7&nbsp;million matured. We entered into this LIBOR cap hedge in the first quarter of 2014 due to a loan agreement requiring a LIBOR cap of 6%. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the
	notional value on a basis swap decreased by $8.6&nbsp;million pursuant to the contractual terms of the
	respective swap agreement. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the change in fair value of the non-qualifying basis swaps and LIBOR caps was approximately $(0.1) million and
	was recorded in interest expense on the consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	changes in the fair value of qualifying interest rate swap cash flow hedges are recorded in accumulated other comprehensive loss on the consolidated balance sheets. These interest
	rate swaps are used to hedge the variable cash flows associated with existing variable-rate debt, and amounts reported in accumulated other comprehensive loss related to derivatives will be
	reclassified to interest expense as interest payments are made on our variable-rate debt. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, all three of our remaining CDO vehicles were unwound and the
	related interest rate swaps with
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	100
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;8&#151;Derivative Financial Instruments (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an
	aggregate notional value of $142.5&nbsp;million and an aggregate fair value of $(4.6) million were terminated and recorded as a loss. See Note&nbsp;7&#151;"Debt
	Obligations&#151;Collateralized Debt Obligations" for further details. Also during 2015, we entered into two qualifying LIBOR cap hedges due to CLO agreements requiring a LIBOR cap of 2% and
	3%, respectively, with a combined notional value of $84.1&nbsp;million. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, two interest swaps matured with a combined notional value of
	$32.0&nbsp;million and the notional value on an interest rate swap decreased by $15.0&nbsp;million pursuant to the contractual terms of the respective swap agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we expect to reclassify $(5.0) million of other comprehensive loss from qualifying cash flow hedges to interest expense over the next twelve months
	assuming interest rates on that date are held constant. These swap agreements must be effective in reducing the variability of cash flows of the hedged items in order to qualify for the aforementioned
	hedge accounting treatment. Gains and losses on terminated swaps are being deferred and recognized in earnings over the original life of the hedged item. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, we
	had a net deferred loss of $0.6&nbsp;million and $1.1&nbsp;million, respectively, in accumulated other comprehensive loss related to these terminated swap agreements. We recorded
	$0.6&nbsp;million, $0.7&nbsp;million and $0.9&nbsp;million as additional interest expense related to the amortization of the loss for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013,
	respectively, and $0.1&nbsp;million, $0.2&nbsp;million and $0.2&nbsp;million as a reduction to interest expense related to the accretion of the net gains for each of the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively. We expect to record $0.5&nbsp;million of net deferred loss to interest expense over the next twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we sold eight remaining RMBS investments, which were accounted for as linked transactions, with an aggregate carrying value of
	$65.7&nbsp;million for $65.8&nbsp;million and recorded a net gain of $0.1&nbsp;million related to the settlement of these linked transactions. The eight RMBS investments were financed with
	repurchase agreements totaling $55.4&nbsp;million which were repaid with the proceeds. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, we recorded $0.3&nbsp;million and $1.9&nbsp;million
	of net interest income, respectively, and a less than $0.1&nbsp;million and $1.7&nbsp;million decrease in fair value, respectively, to other income in the consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	101
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	cumulative amount of other comprehensive loss related to net unrealized losses on derivatives designated as qualifying hedges as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 of approximately
	$(5.3) million and $(15.0) million, respectively, is a combination of the fair value of qualifying cash flow hedges of $(4.7) million and $(13.9) million, respectively, deferred losses on terminated
	interest rate swaps of $(0.7) million and $(1.2) million, respectively, partially offset by deferred net gains on termination of interest rate swaps of approximately $0.1&nbsp;million for both
	periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have agreements with certain of our derivative counterparties that contain a provision where if we default on any of our indebtedness, including default where repayment of the
	indebtedness has not been accelerated by the lender, then we could also be declared in default on our derivative obligations. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the fair value of derivatives in
	a net liability position, which includes accrued interest but excludes any adjustment for nonperformance risk related to these agreements, was $(4.6) million and $(9.2) million, respectively. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, we had minimum collateral posting thresholds with certain of our derivative counterparties and had posted collateral of $5.0&nbsp;million and $9.6&nbsp;million,
	respectively, which is recorded in other assets in our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	102
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=105,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=628588,FOLIO='102',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FW76901A.;18',USER='MTITUSS',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:34' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FW76901_1_103">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;9&#151;Variable Interest Entities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have evaluated our loans and investments, mortgage related securities, investments in equity affiliates, senior unsecured notes, junior subordinated notes and CLOs, in order to
	determine if they
	qualify as VIEs or as variable interests in VIEs. This evaluation resulted in determining that our bridge loans, junior participation loans, mezzanine loans, preferred equity investments, investments
	in equity affiliates, junior subordinated notes, CLOs and investments in mortgage related securities are potential VIEs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	involvement with VIEs primarily affects our financial performance and cash flows through amounts recorded in interest income, interest expense, provision for loan losses and through
	activity associated with our derivative instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Consolidated VIEs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consolidate our CLO and CDO subsidiaries, which qualify as VIEs, of which we are the primary beneficiary. These CLOs and CDOs invest
	in real estate and real estate-related securities and are financed by the issuance of CLO and CDO debt securities. We, or one of our affiliates, is named collateral manager, servicer, and special
	servicer for all CLO and CDO collateral assets which we believe gives us the power to direct the most significant economic activities of the entity. We also have exposure to CLO and CDO losses to the
	extent of our equity interests and also have rights to waterfall payments in excess of required payments to CLO and CDO bond investors. As a result of consolidation, equity interests in these CLOs and
	CDOs have been eliminated, and the consolidated balance sheets reflect both the assets held and debt issued by the CLOs and CDOs to third parties. Our operating results and cash flows include the
	gross amounts related to CLO and CDO assets and liabilities as opposed to our net economic interests in the CLO and CDO entities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assets
	held by the CLOs and CDOs are restricted and can be used only to settle obligations of the CLOs and CDOs. The liabilities of the CLOs and CDOs are non-recourse to us and can only
	be satisfied from each CLOs and CDOs respective asset pool. Assets and liabilities related to the CLOs and CDOs are disclosed parenthetically, in the aggregate, in our consolidated balance sheets. See
	Note&nbsp;7&#151;"Debt Obligations" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are not obligated to provide, have not provided, and do not intend to provide financial support to any of the consolidated CLOs and CDOs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Unconsolidated VIEs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We determined that we are not the primary beneficiary of 22 VIEs in which we have a variable interest as of December&nbsp;31, 2015
	because we do not have the ability to direct the activities of the VIEs that most significantly impact each entity's economic performance. VIEs, of which we are not the primary beneficiary, have an
	aggregate carrying amount of $346.5&nbsp;million and exposure to real estate debt of approximately $1.7&nbsp;billion at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	103
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=106,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=932703,FOLIO='103',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FW76901A.;18',USER='MTITUSS',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:34' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FW76901_1_104">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_54"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Represents
	the carrying amount of loans and investments before reserves. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, $152.3&nbsp;million of loans to VIEs had
	corresponding loan loss reserves of $80.6&nbsp;million. See Note&nbsp;3&#151;"Loans and Investments" for further details.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	maximum exposure to loss as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 would not exceed the carrying amount of its investment.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	It
	is not appropriate to consolidate these entities as equity interests are variable interests only to the extent that the investment is considered to be at
	risk. Since our investments were funded by the entities that issued the junior subordinated notes, it is not considered to be at risk.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	104
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;10&#151;Fair Value
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair value estimates are dependent upon subjective assumptions and involve significant uncertainties resulting in variability in
	estimates with changes in assumptions. The following table summarizes the principal amounts, carrying values and the estimated fair values of our financial instruments:
</FONT>
</P>
