<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fair Value Measurement
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair value is defined as the price at which an asset could be exchanged in a current transaction between knowledgeable, willing
	parties. A liability's fair value is defined as the amount that would be paid to transfer the liability to a new obligor, not the amount that would be paid to settle the liability with the creditor.
	Where available, fair value is based on observable market prices or parameters or derived from such prices or parameters. Where observable prices or inputs are not available, valuation models are
	applied. These valuation techniques involve some level of management estimation and judgment, the degree of which is dependent on the price transparency for the instruments or market and the
	instruments' complexity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assets
	and liabilities disclosed at fair value are categorized based upon the level of judgment associated with the inputs used to measure their fair value. Hierarchical levels directly
	related to the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	105
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=108,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=325466,FOLIO='105',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FY76901A.;9',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:16' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FY76901_1_106">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;10&#151;Fair Value (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	amount
	of subjectivity associated with the inputs to fair valuation of these assets and liabilities are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;1&#151;Inputs are unadjusted and quoted prices exist in active markets for identical assets or liabilities at the
	measurement date. The types of assets and liabilities carried at Level&nbsp;1 fair value generally are government and agency securities, equities listed in active markets, investments in publicly
	traded mutual funds with quoted market prices and listed derivatives.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;2&#151;Inputs (other than quoted prices included in Level&nbsp;1) are either directly or indirectly observable
	for the asset or liability through correlation with market data at the measurement date and for the duration of the instrument's anticipated life. Level&nbsp;2 inputs include quoted market prices in
	markets that are not active for an identical or similar asset or liability, and quoted market prices in active markets for a similar asset or liability. Fair valued assets and liabilities that are
	generally included in this category are non-government securities, municipal bonds, certain hybrid financial instruments, certain mortgage and asset-backed securities, certain corporate debt, certain
	commitments and guarantees, certain private equity investments and certain derivatives.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;3&#151;Inputs reflect management's best estimate of what market participants would use in pricing the asset or
	liability at the measurement date. These valuations are based on significant unobservable inputs that require a considerable amount of judgment and assumptions. Consideration is given to the risk
	inherent in the valuation technique and the risk inherent in the inputs to the model. Generally, assets and liabilities carried at fair value and included in this category are certain mortgage and
	asset-backed securities, certain corporate debt, certain private equity investments, certain municipal bonds, certain commitments and guarantees and certain derivatives.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Determining
	which category an asset or liability falls within the hierarchy requires significant judgment and we evaluate our hierarchy disclosures each quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following is a description of the valuation techniques used to measure fair value and the general classification of these instruments pursuant to the fair value hierarchy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loans and investments, net:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values of loans and investments that are not impaired are estimated using Level&nbsp;3 inputs
	based on discounted
	cash flow methodology, using discount rates, which, in the opinion of management, best reflect current market interest rates that would be offered for loans with similar characteristics and credit
	quality. Fair values of loans and investments that are impaired are estimated using Level&nbsp;3 inputs by us that require significant judgments, which include assumptions regarding discount rates,
	capitalization rates, leasing, creditworthiness of major tenants, occupancy rates, availability of financing, exit plan, loan sponsorship, actions of other lenders and other factors deemed necessary
	by management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Available-for-sale securities:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values are approximated based on current market quotes received from active markets or
	financial sources that
	trade such securities. The fair values of available-for-sale equity securities traded in active markets are approximated using Level&nbsp;1 inputs, while the fair values of available-for-sale debt
	securities that are approximated using the recent purchase price and subsequent sales price of the securities, were valued using Level&nbsp;2 inputs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	106
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=109,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=843783,FOLIO='106',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FY76901A.;9',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:16' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FY76901_1_107">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;10&#151;Fair Value (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Derivative financial instruments:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values of interest rate and basis swap derivatives and LIBOR caps are approximated using
	Level&nbsp;2 inputs
	based on current market data received from financial sources that trade such instruments and are based on prevailing market data and derived from third party proprietary models based on well
	recognized financial principles including counterparty risks, credit spreads and interest rate projections, as well as reasonable estimates about relevant future market conditions. These items are
	included in other assets and other liabilities on the consolidated balance sheets. We incorporate credit valuation adjustments in the fair values of our derivative financial instruments to reflect
	counterparty nonperformance risk.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Credit facilities, repurchase agreements, notes payable and mortgage notes payable:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values are estimated at Level&nbsp;3
	using discounted cash
	flow methodology, using discount rates, which, in the opinion of management, best reflect current market interest rates for financing with similar characteristics and credit quality.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Collateralized loan obligations and collateralized debt obligations:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values are estimated at Level&nbsp;3 based on broker
	quotations,
	representing the discounted expected future cash flows at a yield that reflects current market interest rates and credit spreads.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Senior unsecured notes:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values are estimated at Level&nbsp;1 based on current market quotes received from active markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Junior subordinated notes:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair values are estimated at Level&nbsp;3 based on broker quotations, representing the discounted
	expected future cash
	flows at a yield that reflects current market interest rates and credit spreads.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	measure certain financial assets and financial liabilities at fair value on a recurring basis. The fair value of these financial assets and liabilities was determined using the
	following input levels as of December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_56"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:73%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	had an allowance for loan losses of $86.8&nbsp;million relating to nine loans with an aggregate carrying value, before loan loss reserves, of
	approximately $189.2&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loan impairment assessments:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loans held for investment are intended to be held to maturity and, accordingly, are carried at cost,
	net of unamortized
	loan origination costs and fees, loan purchase discounts, and net of the allowance for loan losses when such loan or investment is deemed to be impaired. We consider a loan impaired when, based upon
	current information and events, it is probable that we will be unable to collect all amounts due for both principal and interest according to the contractual terms of the loan agreement. We perform
	evaluations of our loans to determine if the value of the underlying collateral securing the impaired loan is less than the net carrying value of the loan, which may result in an allowance and
	corresponding charge to the provision for loan losses. These valuations require significant judgments, which include assumptions regarding capitalization and discount rates, revenue growth rates,
	leasing, creditworthiness of major tenants, occupancy rates, availability of financing, exit plan, loan sponsorship, actions of other lenders and other factors deemed necessary by management. The
	table above includes all impaired loans, regardless of the period in which an impairment was recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	108
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=112,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=638441,FOLIO='109',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FY76901A.;9',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:16' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FY76901_1_110">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;11&#151;Commitments and Contingencies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Contractual Commitments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our debt obligations have approximate maturities of $144.7&nbsp;million in 2016, $360.7&nbsp;million in 2017, $242.5&nbsp;million
	in 2018, $161.1&nbsp;million in 2019, $23.4&nbsp;million in 2020 and $273.7&nbsp;million thereafter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	accordance with certain loans and investments, we have outstanding unfunded commitments of $11.5&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 that we are obligated to fund as the
	borrowers meet certain requirements. Of this total, we have $3.1&nbsp;million in restricted cash which was available to fund all of the unfunded commitments for loans financed by our CLO vehicles.
	Specific requirements include, but are not limited to, property renovations, building construction, and building conversions based on criteria met by the borrower in accordance with the loan
	agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Litigation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We currently are neither subject to any material litigation nor, to our knowledge, is any material litigation currently threatened
	against us other than the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;15, 2011, three related lawsuits were filed by the Extended Stay Litigation Trust (the "Trust"), a post-bankruptcy litigation trust alleged to have standing to pursue
	claims that previously had been held by Extended Stay,&nbsp;Inc. and the Homestead Village L.L.C. family of companies (together "ESI") (formerly Chapter&nbsp;11 debtors, together the "Debtors")
	that have emerged from bankruptcy. Two of the lawsuits were filed in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York, and the third in the Supreme Court of the State of New York, New
	York County. There were 73&nbsp;defendants in the three lawsuits, including 55 corporate and partnership entities and 18 individuals. A subsidiary of ours and certain other entities that are
	affiliates of ours are included as defendants. The New York State Court action has been removed to the Bankruptcy Court. Our affiliates filed a motion to dismiss the three lawsuits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	lawsuits all allege, as a factual basis and background certain facts surrounding the June 2007 leveraged buyout of ESI from affiliates of Blackstone Capital. Our subsidiary, Arbor
	ESH II,&nbsp;LLC, had a $115.0&nbsp;million investment in the Series A1 Preferred Units of a holding company of Extended Stay,&nbsp;Inc. The New York State Court action and one of the two
	federal court actions name as defendants, Arbor ESH II,&nbsp;LLC, Arbor Commercial Mortgage,&nbsp;LLC and ABT-ESI&nbsp;LLC, an entity in which we have a membership interest, among the broad
	group of defendants. These two actions were commenced by substantially identical complaints. The defendants are alleged in these complaints, among other things, to have breached fiduciary and
	contractual duties by causing or allowing the
	Debtors to pay illegal dividends or other improper distributions of value at a time when the Debtors were insolvent. These two complaints also allege that the defendants aided and abetted, induced, or
	participated in breaches of fiduciary duty, waste, and unjust enrichment ("Fiduciary Duty Claims") and name a director of ours, and a former general counsel of Arbor Commercial Mortgage,&nbsp;LLC,
	each of whom had served on the Board of Directors of ESI for a period of time. We are defending these two defendants and paying the costs of such defense. On the basis of the foregoing allegations,
	the Trust has asserted claims under a number of common law theories, seeking the return of assets transferred by the Debtors prior to the Debtors' bankruptcy filing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the third action, filed in Bankruptcy Court, the same plaintiff, the Trust, has named Arbor Commercial Mortgage,&nbsp;LLC and ABT-ESI&nbsp;LLC, together with a number of other
	defendants and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	110
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=113,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=1006956,FOLIO='110',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]FY76901A.;9',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:16' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FY76901_1_111">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;11&#151;Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	asserts
	claims, including constructive and fraudulent conveyance claims under state and federal statutes, as well as a claim under the Federal Debt Collection Procedure Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;28, 2013, the Trust filed a motion to amend the lawsuits, to, among other things, (i)&nbsp;consolidate the lawsuits into one lawsuit, (ii)&nbsp;remove 47 defendants,
	none of whom are related to us, from the lawsuits so that there are 26 remaining defendants, including 16 corporate and partnership entities and 10 individuals, and (iii)&nbsp;reduce the counts
	within the lawsuits from over 100 down to 17. The remaining counts in the amended complaint against our affiliates are principally state law claims for breach of fiduciary duties, waste, unlawful
	dividends and unjust enrichment, and claims under the Bankruptcy Code for avoidance and recovery actions, among others. The bankruptcy court granted the motion and the amended complaint has been
	filed. The amended complaint seeks approximately $139.0&nbsp;million in the aggregate from director designees, portions of which are also sought from our affiliates as well as from unaffiliated
	defendants. We have moved to dismiss the referenced actions and intend to vigorously defend against the claims asserted therein. During a status conference held on March&nbsp;18, 2014, the Court
	heard oral argument on the motion to dismiss and adjourned the case pending a ruling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have not made a loss accrual for this litigation because we believe that it is not probable that a loss has been incurred and an amount cannot be reasonably estimated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;12&#151;Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Preferred Stock
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In February 2014, we completed an underwritten public offering of 900,000 shares of 8.50% Series&nbsp;C cumulative redeemable
	preferred stock with a liquidation preference of $25.00 per share, generating net proceeds of $21.6&nbsp;million after deducting the underwriting discount and other offering expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Series&nbsp;A, B and C preferred stock may not be redeemed by us before February 2018, May 2018 and February 2019, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Common Stock
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In February 2014, we entered into an "At-The-Market" ("ATM") equity offering sales agreement with JMP Securities&nbsp;LLC ("JMP")
	whereby, in accordance with the terms of the agreement, from time to time we may issue and sell through JMP up to 7,500,000 shares of our common stock. Sales of the shares are made by means of
	ordinary brokers' transactions or otherwise at market prices prevailing at the time of sale, or at negotiated prices. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we sold 1,000,000&nbsp;shares
	for net proceeds of $6.5&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 6,500,000 shares are available for sale under this offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	used the net proceeds from our preferred and common offerings to make investments, to repurchase or pay liabilities and for general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of February&nbsp;26, 2016, we have $330.4&nbsp;million available under our $500.0&nbsp;million shelf registration statement that was declared effective by the SEC in August
	2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	111
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Preferred
	Stock&#151;The dividend declared on February&nbsp;2, 2015 was for the period December&nbsp;1, 2014 through February&nbsp;28, 2015.
	The dividend declared on April&nbsp;29, 2015 was for the period March&nbsp;1, 2015 through May&nbsp;31, 2015. The dividend declared on July&nbsp;29, 2015 was for the period June&nbsp;1, 2015
	through August&nbsp;31, 2015. The dividend declared on November&nbsp;2, 2015 was for the period September&nbsp;1, 2015 through November&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Common Stock
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;On February&nbsp;24, 2016, the Board of Directors declared a cash dividend of $0.15 per share of common stock. The dividend is payable
	on March&nbsp;15, 2016 to common stockholders of record as the close of business on March&nbsp;10, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Preferred Stock
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;On February&nbsp;1, 2016, the Board of Directors declared a cash dividend of $0.515625 per share of 8.25% Series&nbsp;A preferred
	stock; a cash dividend of $0.484375 per share of 7.75% Series&nbsp;B preferred stock; and a cash dividend of $0.53125 per share of 8.50% Series&nbsp;C preferred stock. These amounts reflect
	dividends from December&nbsp;1, 2015 through February&nbsp;29, 2016 and are payable on February&nbsp;29, 2016 to preferred stockholders of record on February&nbsp;15, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	declared and paid distributions of $14,459, $14,698 and $14,500 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, representing the 12.5% return on the
	preferred shares issued to third parties by our subsidiary REIT.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	must currently distribute at least 90% of our taxable income in order to qualify as a REIT and must distribute 100% of our taxable income in order not to be subject to corporate
	federal income taxes on retained income. We anticipate we will distribute all of our taxable income to our stockholders. Because taxable income differs from cash flow from operations due to non-cash
	revenues or expenses (such as depreciation or provision for loan losses), in certain circumstances, we may generate operating cash flow in excess of our distributions or, alternatively, may be
	required to borrow to make sufficient distribution payments. We were in compliance with all REIT requirements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	112
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_62"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
	is the initial year for the Series&nbsp;C preferred stock dividend.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Qualified
	dividend income is eligible for reduced dividend rates.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;59(d), alternative minimum tax ("AMT") could be apportioned between a REIT and its stockholders to the extent that the REIT distributes
	it regular taxable income. Since we have distributed our taxable income, the AMT adjustments are being apportioned to our stockholders. As such, we have determined that 11.296% of each distribution to
	our stockholders for the tax year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 consists of an AMT adjustment (i.e.,&nbsp;for each $1 of dividend reportable by a stockholder, $0.11296 represents an AMT
	adjustment).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Deferred Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have a stock incentive plan under which the Board of Directors has the authority to issue shares of stock to certain directors,
	officers and employees of ours and our Manager.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	May 2015, we issued 20,430 shares of fully vested common stock to certain independent members of the Board of Directors under the 2014 Plan and recorded $0.1&nbsp;million to selling
	and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	113
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;12&#151;Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2015, we issued 328,400 shares of restricted common stock under the 2014 Plan to certain employees of ours and our Manager, inclusive of 105,000 shares granted to our chief
	executive officer, Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, with a total grant date fair value of $2.3&nbsp;million and recorded $0.4&nbsp;million to employee compensation and benefits and $0.4&nbsp;million to
	selling and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income. One third of the shares vested as of the date of grant, one third will vest in March 2016, and the remaining third will
	vest in March 2017. In March 2015, we also issued 63,000 shares of fully vested common stock to the independent members of the Board of Directors under the 2014 Plan and recorded $0.4&nbsp;million
	to selling and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the first quarter of 2015, we issued 74,294 shares of restricted common stock to Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman under his 2015 annual incentive agreement with a grant date fair value of
	$0.5&nbsp;million and recorded $0.1&nbsp;million to employee compensation and benefits in our consolidated statements of income. One quarter of the shares vest as of the date of grant and one
	quarter will vest on each of the first, second and third anniversaries of the date of grant. Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman was also granted up to 445,765 performance-based restricted stock units that vest at the
	end of a four-year performance period based on the our achievement of certain total stockholder return objectives. The restricted stock units had a grant date fair value of $1.2&nbsp;million and we
	recorded $0.3&nbsp;million to employee compensation and benefits in our consolidated statements of income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, unvested restricted stock consisted of 212,241 shares granted to our employees with a grant date fair value of $1.5&nbsp;million and 154,169 shares
	granted to employees of our Manager with a grant date fair value of $1.1&nbsp;million, which is subject to remeasurement each reporting period. Expense is recognized ratably over the vesting period
	in our consolidated statements of income in selling and administrative expense and employee compensation and benefits expense, respectively. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we recorded
	the ratable portion of the unvested restricted stock to employees as employee compensation and benefits for $0.9&nbsp;million and for non-employees to selling and administrative expense for
	$0.8&nbsp;million. During the second quarter of 2015, 916 shares of unvested restricted stock with a grant date value of less than $0.1&nbsp;million were forfeited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	May 2014, we issued 278,000 shares of restricted common stock under the 2014 Plan to certain employees of ours and our Manager with a total grant date fair value of
	$2.0&nbsp;million and recorded $0.3&nbsp;million to employee compensation and benefits and $0.3&nbsp;million to selling and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income. One
	third of the shares vested as of the date of grant, one third vested in May 2015, and the remaining third will vest in May 2016. In May 2014, we also issued 63,000 shares of fully vested common stock
	to the independent members of the Board of Directors under the 2014 Plan and recorded $0.4&nbsp;million to selling and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, unvested restricted stock consisted of 138,584 shares granted to employees of our Manager with a grant date fair value of $1.0&nbsp;million, which is subject to
	remeasurement each reporting period, and 110,666 shares granted to our employees with a
	grant date fair value of $0.8&nbsp;million. Expense is recognized ratably over the vesting period in our consolidated statements of income in selling and administrative expense and employee
	compensation and benefits expense, respectively. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 we recorded the ratable portion of the unvested restricted stock to employees as employee compensation
	and benefits for
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	114
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;12&#151;Equity (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$0.4&nbsp;million
	and for non-employees to selling and administrative expense for $0.5&nbsp;million in our consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	May 2013, we issued 70,000 shares of fully vested common stock to the independent members of the Board of Directors under the 2003 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended and restated in
	2009 (the "2003 Plan"), and recorded $0.5&nbsp;million to selling and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income. In February 2013, we issued 192,750 shares of restricted common
	stock under the 2003 Plan to certain employees of ours and our Manager with a total grant date fair value of $1.5&nbsp;million and recorded $0.2&nbsp;million to employee compensation and benefits
	and $0.4&nbsp;million to selling and administrative expense in our consolidated statements of income. One third of the shares vested as of the date of grant, one third vested in February 2014, and
	the remaining third vested in February 2015. During the third quarter of 2013, 667 shares of unvested restricted stock with a grant date fair value of less than $0.1&nbsp;million were forfeited. As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2013, unvested restricted stock consisted of 82,500 shares granted to non-employees with a grant date fair value of $0.7&nbsp;million, which is subject to remeasurement each
	reporting period, and 45,333 shares granted to our employees with a grant date fair value of $0.4&nbsp;million. Expense is recognized ratably over the vesting period in our consolidated statements
	of income in selling and administrative expense and employee compensation and benefits expense, respectively. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recorded the ratable portion of the
	unvested restricted stock to employee compensation and benefits for $0.2&nbsp;million and to selling and administrative expense for $0.3&nbsp;million in our consolidated statements of income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting
	of restricted shares is dependent on a service requirement. Dividends paid on restricted shares are recorded as dividends on shares of our common stock whether or not they are
	vested. For accounting purposes, we measure the compensation costs for these shares as of the date of the grant, with subsequent remeasurement for any unvested shares granted to non-employees of ours
	with such amounts expensed against earnings, at the grant date (for the portion that vest immediately) or ratably over the respective vesting periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Warrants
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with a debt restructuring with Wachovia Bank in 2009, we issued Wachovia 1,000,000 warrants at an average strike price of
	$4.00 and an expiration date in July 2015. On July&nbsp;1, 2014, we acquired and canceled all of the warrants in return for the payment of $2.6&nbsp;million, recorded to additional paid in
	capital, which reflects a 5% discount to the prior day closing price of our common stock of $6.95.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At December&nbsp;31, 2015, accumulated other comprehensive loss was $4.8&nbsp;million and consisted of $4.7&nbsp;million of net
	unrealized losses on derivatives designated as cash flow hedges, and $0.6&nbsp;million of net deferred losses on terminated interest swaps, less a $0.4&nbsp;million unrealized gain related to
	available-for-sale securities. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, accumulated other comprehensive loss was $14.7&nbsp;million and consisted of $13.9&nbsp;million of net unrealized losses on derivatives
	designated as cash flow hedges, and $1.1&nbsp;million of net deferred losses on terminated interest swaps, less a $0.3&nbsp;million unrealized gain related to available-for-sale securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	115
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_GRID,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_CASH_FLOW>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	See
	Note&nbsp;8&#151;"Derivative Financial Instruments" for additional details.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	See
	Note&nbsp;4&#151;"Securities" for additional details.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Noncontrolling Interest
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We had a noncontrolling interest representing a third party's one third interest in the equity of a consolidated subsidiary that owns
	an investment that carried a note payable related to the exchange of a profits interest transaction. In the fourth quarter of 2013, the entity's operating agreement was amended to provide joint
	control to the members of the entity, and therefore, the entity was deconsolidated. Upon completion of this transaction, we deconsolidated the entity and noncontrolling interest was reduced to zero.
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, we recorded income of $0.1&nbsp;million as well as distributions of $2.1&nbsp;million attributable to the noncontrolling interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;13&#151;Earnings Per Share
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Basic EPS is calculated by dividing net income attributable to Arbor Realty Trust,&nbsp;Inc. by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during each period
	inclusive of unvested restricted stock with full dividend participation rights. Diluted EPS is calculated by dividing net income by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding
	plus the additional dilutive effect of common stock equivalents during each period using the treasury stock method. Our common stock equivalents include the weighted average dilutive effect of
	performance-based restricted stock units granted to our chief executive officer in the first quarter of 2015 as well as the weighted average dilutive effect of warrants for the period of time that
	they were outstanding during 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	116
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net
	of preferred stock dividends and noncontrolling interest.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman
	was granted restricted stock units which vest at the end of a four-year performance period based upon our achievement of total
	stockholder return objectives. See Note&nbsp;12&#151;"Equity" for further details.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	July&nbsp;1, 2014, we acquired and canceled all of our warrants. See Note&nbsp;12&#151;"Equity" for further details.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;14&#151;Agreements and Transactions with Related Parties
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Management Agreement
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We, ARLP and Arbor Realty SR,&nbsp;Inc. have a management agreement with our Manager, pursuant to which our Manager provides certain
	services and we pay our Manager a base management fee and under certain circumstances, an annual incentive fee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Manager has agreed to provide us with structured finance investment opportunities and loan servicing as well as other services necessary to operate our business. We rely to a
	significant extent on the facilities and resources of our Manager to conduct our operations. Our Manager's management of us is under the direction or supervision of our Board of Directors. The
	management agreement requires our Manager to manage our business affairs in conformity with the policies and the general investment guidelines that are approved and monitored by our Board of
	Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	and our operating partnership have also entered into a services agreement with our Manager pursuant to which our asset management group provides asset management services to our
	Manager. In the event the services provided by our asset management group pursuant to the agreement exceed by more than 15% per quarter the level of activity anticipated by the Board of Directors, we
	will negotiate in good faith with our Manager an adjustment to the Manager's base management fee under the management agreement, to reflect the scope of the services, the quantity of serviced assets
	or the time required to be devoted to the services by our asset management group.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	117
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=120,EFW="2227477",CP="ARBOR REALTY TRUST, INC.",DN="1",CHK=734068,FOLIO='117',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCW1.15ZCW76901]GA76901A.;8',USER='OALBERT',CD='25-FEB-2016;11:32' -->
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_GA76901_1_118">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;14&#151;Agreements and Transactions with Related Parties (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	base management fee is an arrangement whereby we reimburse our Manager for its actual costs incurred in managing our business based on the parties' agreement in advance on an annual
	budget with subsequent quarterly true-ups to actual costs. We retain all origination fees on investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	incentive fee is measured on an annual basis and is calculated as (1)&nbsp;25% of the amount by which (a)&nbsp;our funds from operations per share, adjusted for certain gains and
	losses including gains from the retirement and restructuring of debt and 60% of any loan loss reserve recoveries (spread over a three year period), exceeds (b)&nbsp;the product of (x)&nbsp;9.5%
	per annum or the Ten Year U.S. Treasury Rate plus 3.5%, whichever is greater, and (y)&nbsp;the greater of $10.00 or the weighted average of book value of the net assets contributed by our Manager to
	ARLP per ARLP partnership unit, the offering price per share of our common equity in the private offering on July&nbsp;1, 2003 and subsequent offerings and the issue price per ARLP partnership unit
	for subsequent contributions to ARLP, multiplied by (2)&nbsp;the weighted average of our outstanding shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	minimum return, or incentive fee hurdle to be reached before an incentive fee is earned, is a percentage applied on a per share basis to the greater of $10.00 or the average gross
	proceeds per share. In addition, 60% of any loan loss and other reserve recoveries are eligible to be included in the incentive fee calculation, which recoveries are spread over a three year period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	management agreement also allows us to consider, from time to time, the payment of additional "success-based" fees to our Manager for accomplishing certain specified corporate
	objectives; has a termination fee of $10.0&nbsp;million; and is renewable automatically for successive one-year terms, unless terminated with six months prior written notice. If we terminate or
	elect not to renew the management agreement without cause, we are required to pay the termination fee of $10.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Manager is responsible for all costs incident to the performance of its duties under the management agreement, including compensation of its employees, rent for facilities and other
	"overhead" expenses. We are required to pay our Manager management fees as well as reimburse our Manager for all expenses incurred on our behalf in connection with the raising of capital or the
	incurrence of debt, interest expenses, taxes and license fees, litigation and extraordinary or non-recurring expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Manager, pursuant to the management agreement, and Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman, pursuant to his non-competition agreement, have granted us a right of first refusal to pursue all opportunities
	identified by them or their affiliates to invest in multifamily and commercial mortgage loans and customized financing transactions, including bridge loans, mezzanine loans, preferred equity
	investments, note acquisitions and participation interests in owners of real properties (collectively, "Structured Finance Investments") as long as such investment opportunities are consistent with
	our investment objectives and guidelines and such investments would not adversely affect our status as a REIT. These agreements also provide that our Manager or Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman, as the case may be,
	may pursue any opportunity in Structured Finance Investments if the opportunity is rejected by both our credit committee and a majority of our independent directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to the management agreement and Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman's non-competition agreement, we have agreed not to pursue, and to allow our Manager and its affiliates, including
	Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman, to pursue opportunities to invest in multifamily and commercial mortgage loans that meet the underwriting and approval guidelines of Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, the Federal Housing
	Administration and conduit
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	118
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_GA76901_1_119">

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>

</B>

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;14&#151;Agreements and Transactions with Related Parties (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	commercial
	lending programs secured by first liens on real property (collectively, the "Manager Target Investments"). In addition to its exclusive right to pursue Manager Target Investments, our
	Manager and its affiliates may pursue any other type of investment (except Structured Finance Investments) without our consent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table sets forth our base management fees and incentive fees for the periods indicated:
</FONT>
</P>

	Year Ended December&nbsp;31,
</B>
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, no "success-based" payments were made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Beginning
	January&nbsp;1, 2014, we directly compensate our chief executive officer $1.0&nbsp;million in annual base compensation as an employee. As such, this compensation is now
	recorded as employee compensation and benefits, which was previously recorded as part of the base management fee prior to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2007, our Manager received an incentive fee installment totaling $19.0&nbsp;million which was recorded as a prepaid management fee related to the incentive fee on
	$77.1&nbsp;million of deferred revenue recognized on the transfer of control of the 450 West 33
<SUP>
	rd
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Street property, which is one of our equity affiliates. The
	$77.1&nbsp;million gain was deferred as a result of guarantying a portion of the property's indebtedness. In July 2014, the existing debt on the property was refinanced and our portion of the
	guarantee was terminated, resulting in the recognition of the deferred gain and a $19.0&nbsp;million prepaid incentive management fee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other Related Party Transactions
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Due from related party was $8.1&nbsp;million and less than $0.1&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively,
	and consisted primarily of paydowns to be remitted and escrows held by our Manager and its affiliates related to real estate transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Due
	to related party was $3.4&nbsp;million and $2.7&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, and consisted primarily of base management fees due to our
	Manager that we remitted in the following quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	November 2015, we originated a $7.1&nbsp;million bridge loan on a multifamily property owned by a consortium of investors consisting of certain of our officers, including
	Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, who together
	own an interest of approximately 7.5% in the borrowing entity. The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR plus 4.50% with a LIBOR floor of 0.25% and a maturity date of November 2018 with two one-year
	extension options. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $0.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	119
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227477Z10-K_HTM_BG76901A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	ARBOR REALTY TRUST,&nbsp;INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;14&#151;Agreements and Transactions with Related Parties (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2015, we originated two bridge loans totaling $16.7&nbsp;million secured by multifamily properties acquired by a third party investor. The properties had been owned and were
	sold by a consortium of investors, consisting of certain of our officers, including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, certain other related parties and certain unaffiliated persons. The loans have an interest
	rate of LIBOR plus 5.00% with a LIBOR floor of 0.25% and a maturity date of October 2017. Interest income recorded from these loans totaled $0.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, we originated a $3.0&nbsp;million mezzanine loan on a multifamily property that has a $47.0&nbsp;million first mortgage initially originated by our Manager. The loan
	bears interest at a fixed rate of 12.5% and has a maturity date of April 2025. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $0.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, we originated a $6.3&nbsp;million bridge loan on a multifamily property owned by a consortium of investors consisting of certain of our officers, including
	Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman and our Manager, who together own an interest of approximately 90% in the borrowing entity. The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR plus 4.50% with a LIBOR floor of 0.25% and a
	maturity date of April 2018. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $0.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2015, we modified an $18.0&nbsp;million preferred equity investment, increasing our balance to $23.0&nbsp;million with a fixed interest rate of 10% and a maturity date of
	February 2018. In order to accomplish the modification, we formed a joint venture with a consortium of investors consisting of certain of our officers, including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, and other
	related parties, to invest in an additional $2.0&nbsp;million preferred equity investment that is generally subordinate to ours. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $2.3&nbsp;million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the first quarter of 2015, we invested $9.6&nbsp;million for 50% of our Manager's indirect interest in a joint venture with a third party that was formed to invest in a residential
	mortgage banking business. As a result of this transaction, we had an initial indirect interest of 22.5% in this entity. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we invested $9.7&nbsp;million
	through this joint venture in non-qualified residential mortgages purchased from the mortgage banking business's origination platform. We recorded income of $6.6&nbsp;million from these investments
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. See Note&nbsp;5&#151;"Investment in Equity Affiliates" for further details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the third quarter of 2014, we invested $0.1&nbsp;million for a 5% interest in a joint venture that owns two multifamily properties. The joint venture consists of a consortium of
	investors consisting of certain of our officers, including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, and other related parties, who together own an interest of approximately 95%. In August 2014, we originated two
	bridge loans totaling $5.0&nbsp;million to the joint venture with an interest rate of 5.5% over one-month LIBOR and a maturity date extended to March 2016. Interest income recorded from these loans
	totaled $0.3&nbsp;million and $0.1&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	July 2014, we originated a $30.4&nbsp;million bridge loan for an office property owned by a consortium of investors including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman and his affiliates, who
	together own an interest of approximately 24% in the borrowing entity. The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR plus 7.90% with a LIBOR floor of 0.50% and a maturity date that was extended to January
	2017. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $2.8&nbsp;million and $1.2&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
</P>

	120

<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	2014, respectively. In January 2016, we also originated a $4.6&nbsp;million mezzanine loan to this entity that has a fixed interest rate of 12% and a maturity of January 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2014, we originated a $1.4&nbsp;million preferred equity investment on a multifamily property that has a $28.5&nbsp;million first mortgage initially originated by our
	Manager. The loan bears interest at a fixed rate of 14% and has a maturity date of May 2024. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $0.2&nbsp;million for both the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	March 2014, we originated a bridge loan to a third party borrower for a portfolio of properties with an unpaid principal balance of $70.1&nbsp;million, of which,
	$15.0&nbsp;million was financed with junior loan participations to our Manager. The loan has an interest rate of 6.38% and a maturity date of March 2016. In May 2014, the junior loan participations
	to our Manager were paid off. The participations had a weighted average interest rate of 7.20% and a maturity date of March 2016. Interest income related to the junior loan participations recorded
	from this loan totaled $3.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	had two loans totaling $22.4&nbsp;million, which were secured by a property purchased in 2011 by a third party borrower from our Manager. In the first quarter 2014, our Manager
	purchased the property from the prior borrower subject to our loans. In connection with this purchase, our Manager paid down the loans by $2.3&nbsp;million and we restructured our remaining debt
	outstanding into a first mortgage of $14.6&nbsp;million with a maturity date of March 2015 and a second mortgage of $5.1&nbsp;million with a maturity date of April 2015, both with an interest rate
	of LIBOR plus 4.80%. The maturity date on both of
	these loans was extended to April 2016, which we considered to be a troubled debt restructuring. Interest income recorded from these loans totaled $1.1&nbsp;million, $0.9&nbsp;million and
	$1.5&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2013, we purchased, at par, a $3.0&nbsp;million mezzanine loan from our Manager who originated the loan in September 2013 to a third party entity. The loan had a fixed
	interest rate of 13.00% and a maturity date of October 2018 and was paid off in the third quarter of 2014. Interest income recorded from this loan was $0.3&nbsp;million and $0.1&nbsp;million for
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	June 2013, our Board of Directors formed a special committee consisting of independent directors in connection with the exploration and evaluation of a potential transaction with our
	Manager involving the acquisition of our Manager's Fannie Mae, DUS, Freddie Mac, FHA and CMBS platforms, as well as the internalization of the management of our current business. There were
	preliminary discussions between the special committee and representatives of our Manager regarding a potential transaction during the second and third quarters of 2013. In late June of 2014,
	preliminary discussions regarding a possible transaction resumed and in February 2016, we entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the agency platform of our Manager for $250.0&nbsp;million.
	See Note&nbsp;18&#151;"Subsequent Event" for further details. In connection with evaluating this potential transaction, we incurred advisory fees totaling $3.1&nbsp;million and
	$1.4&nbsp;million during 2015 and 2013, respectively. No such expenses were incurred during 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2013, we originated six bridge loans totaling $53.0&nbsp;million for a portfolio of multifamily properties owned by a consortium of investors including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman
	and his affiliates and Mr.&nbsp;Fred Weber, our executive vice president of structured finance, who together own an interest of
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	approximately
	19% in the borrowing entity. The loans had an interest rate of one-month LIBOR plus 7.25% and a maturity date of April 2015, which were paid off in the fourth quarter of 2013. In
	November 2013, we originated a new bridge loan for $2.0&nbsp;million with an interest rate of one-month LIBOR plus 5.50%, which was paid off in the second quarter of 2014. Interest income recorded
	from these loans totaled $0.1&nbsp;million and $3.1&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2013, we also purchased, at par, a $6.4&nbsp;million bridge loan from our Manager who originated the loan in March 2013 to a third party entity that acquired the property from
	an entity owned by Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman and his affiliates and Mr.&nbsp;Fred Weber, who together also provided a $1.1&nbsp;million preferred equity contribution to the overall transaction.
	Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman also provided a $1.0&nbsp;million personal guaranty on the bridge loan. The bridge loan bore interest at a rate of one-month LIBOR
	plus 5.00% for the first year then one-month LIBOR plus 6.00% thereafter and had a maturity date of March 2015 with three one year extension options, and was paid off in the second quarter of 2014.
	Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $0.2&nbsp;million for both the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2013, we originated a $7.5&nbsp;million bridge loan for a multifamily property. William C. Green, who serves on our Board of Directors, holds a 6.6% partnership interest in
	the borrowing entity and is the chief financial officer of an affiliated entity that is a partner in, and the management company for, the borrowing entity. Mr.&nbsp;Green also provided a
	$0.4&nbsp;million personal guaranty on the bridge loan. The loan bore interest at a rate of one-month LIBOR plus 6.00%, had a maturity date of January 2015, and was paid off in the second quarter of
	2014. Interest income recorded from this loan totaled $0.2&nbsp;million and $0.5&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	December 2011, we completed a restructuring of a $67.6&nbsp;million preferred equity investment on the Lexford Portfolio ("Lexford"), which is a portfolio of multifamily assets. We,
	along with a consortium of independent outside investors, made an additional preferred equity investment of $25.0&nbsp;million in Lexford of which we held a $10.5&nbsp;million interest, and
	Mr.&nbsp;Fred Weber, our executive vice president of structured finance, held a $0.5&nbsp;million interest, which was paid down to $22.5&nbsp;million in the third quarter of 2013, and then paid
	off in the fourth quarter of 2013. The original preferred equity investment bore a fixed rate of interest of 2.36%, revised from an original rate of LIBOR plus 5.00% (the loan was paying a modified
	rate of LIBOR plus 1.65% at the time of the new investment). The original preferred equity investment was paid down during 2014 and 2015 and the remaining balance was paid off in July 2015. The
	additional preferred equity investment had a fixed interest rate of 12% and a maturity date in June 2020. Interest income recorded from the additional preferred equity investment totaled
	$1.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. We, along with the same outside investors, also made a $0.1&nbsp;million equity investment into Lexford, of which we held a $44,000
	noncontrolling interest, and do not have the power to control the significant activities of the entity. During 2011, we recorded losses from the entity against the equity investment, reducing the
	balance to zero. In the third and fourth quarters of 2015, we received distributions from this equity investment and recognized income of $4.5&nbsp;million, net of expenses. The $4.5&nbsp;million
	of income is comprised of income from equity affiliates of $5.5&nbsp;million, partially offset by $1.0&nbsp;million of expenses related to these distributions that were recorded in employee
	compensation and benefits. In addition, under the terms of the restructuring, Lexford's first mortgage lender required a change of property manager for the
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Note&nbsp;14&#151;Agreements and Transactions with Related Parties (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	underlying
	assets. The new management company is an affiliate of Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, our chief executive officer, and has a contract with the new entity for 7.5&nbsp;years and is entitled to
	4.75% of gross revenues of the underlying properties, along with the potential to share in the proceeds of a sale or refinancing of the debt should the management company remain engaged by the new
	entity at the time of such capital event. In 2012, Mr.&nbsp;Fred Weber invested $250,000 in the new management company and currently owns a 23.5% ownership interest. Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman and his
	affiliates currently own a 53.9% ownership interest. We have provided limited ("bad boy") guarantees for certain debt controlled by Lexford. The bad boy guarantees may become a liability for us upon
	standard "bad" acts such as fraud
	or a material misrepresentation by Lexford or us. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, this debt had an aggregate outstanding balance of $849.1&nbsp;million and is scheduled to mature between 2017 and 2025.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	income recorded from additional loans originated in 2012 or prior years with our affiliates totaled $0.3&nbsp;million, $1.5&nbsp;million and $2.2&nbsp;million for the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2016, we originated a $12.7&nbsp;million bridge loan and a $5.2&nbsp;million preferred equity investment on two multifamily properties owned by a consortium of investors
	consisting of certain of our officers, including Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, who together own an interest of approximately 50% in the borrowing entity. The bridge loan has an interest rate of one-month
	LIBOR plus 4.50% with a LIBOR floor of 0.25% and a maturity date of January 2019. The preferred equity investment has a fixed interest rate of 10% and a maturity date of April 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2016, we originated a $19.0&nbsp;million bridge loan on a multifamily property owned by a consortium of investors consisting of certain of our officers, including
	Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, who together own an interest of approximately 7.5% in the borrowing entity. The loan has an interest rate of one-month LIBOR plus 4.50% with a LIBOR floor of 0.25% and a
	maturity date of January 2019.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are dependent upon our Manager with whom we have a conflict of interest, to provide services to us that are vital to our operations. Our chairman, chief executive officer and
	president, Mr.&nbsp;Ivan Kaufman, is also the chief executive officer and president of our Manager, and, our chief financial officer and treasurer, Mr.&nbsp;Paul Elenio, is the chief financial
	officer of our Manager. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman and his affiliated entities ("the Kaufman Entities") together beneficially own approximately 92% of the outstanding membership interests of our
	Manager and certain of our employees and directors also hold an ownership interest in our Manager. Furthermore, one of our former directors is general counsel to our Manager and another of our
	directors also serves as the trustee of one of the Kaufman Entities that holds a majority of the outstanding membership interests in our Manager and co-trustee of another Kaufman Entity that owns an
	equity interest in our Manager. Our Manager currently holds approximately 5.3&nbsp;million of our common shares, representing approximately 10.5% of the voting power of our outstanding stock as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. Our Board of Directors approved a resolution under our charter allowing Ivan Kaufman and our Manager, (which Mr.&nbsp;Kaufman has a controlling equity interest in), to own
	more than the 5% ownership interest limit of our common stock as stated in our charter as amended.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	123

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227477Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_GC76901_1_124">
</A>
